1. Statement 1: "TRAFFIC, an autonomous body under the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP)," which means that TRAFFIC is an independent organization but operates within the framework of UNEP, working towards its goals and objectives. It also suggests that TRAFFIC has a close relationship with UNEP.
2. Statement 2: "TRAFFIC's mission is to ensure that trade in wild plants and animals does not threaten nature conservation." This statement highlights one of the primary missions of TRAFFIC, which is to promote sustainable use of natural resources by ensuring that trade practices do not harm the environment or species conservation efforts.

6. ‘वाणिज्य में प्राणिजात और वनस्पति-जात के व्यापार-संबंधी विश्लेषण (टेªड रिलेटेड ऐनालिसिस ऑफ फौना ऐंड फ्रलोरा इन कॉमर्स / TRAFFIC)श् के संदर्भ में निम्नलिखित कथनों पर विचार कीजिए:
1- TRAFFIC, संयुक्त राष्ट्र पर्यावरण कार्यक्रम (UNEP) के अंतर्गत एक ब्यूरो है।
2- TRAFFIC का मिशन यह सुनिश्चित करना है कि वन्य पादपों और जन्तुओं के व्यापार से प्रकृति के संरक्षण को खतरा न हो।

उपर्युक्त कथनों में से कौन-सा/से सही है/हैं?

(a) केवल 1
(b) केवल 2
(c) 1 और 2 दोनों
(d) न तो 1 और न ही 2

, choose correct answer:

data.sampled:
The correct answer is option (c) keval 3.
Explanation:

* Statement 1 is incorrect because the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) of Reserve Bank of India does not determine the benchmark interest rates. It only sets the policy rate which is used as a reference for determining other interest rates in the economy such as lending and deposit rates of banks.
* Statement 2 is correct. MPC consists of twelve members including six outside experts appointed by Government on recommendation of a Search-cum-Selection Committee headed by Cabinet Secretary; three nominees from Union Ministry of Finance; one nominee each from the Ministry of Agriculture; and the Governor of the Reserve Bank of India. Each member has one vote and in case of tie, the Governor's vote shall be decisive. MPC meets at least four times a year or more frequently as considered necessary.
* Statement 3 is also correct. MPC is chaired by Union Minister of State for finance and includes governor of Reserve bank of india . Its main task is to maintain price stability with a target inflation rate of 4% plus or minus two percent for half of the previous trend rate of inflation.

The first statement is saying that a non-government bill or legislation is one which is introduced by a member of Parliament who is not an elected government representative but is nominated by the President of India. This type of bill can be introduced in either House of Parliament.

The second statement is saying that recently, for the first time in Indian parliamentary history, such a non-government bill was passed by the Lok Sabha to amend the Constitution - this bill pertains to the rights of citizenship. (a) भावनगर में
(b) भीमुनिपटनम में
(c) चांदीपुर में
(d) नागपट्टिनम में

, choose correct answer:

data.sampled:
The given cut off seems to be incorrect or incomplete as it is missing option for answer 'd' which corresponds to options 1, 2 and 3. So the correct question would be:
```less
14. In the context of addressing issues related to pollution, what are some benefits of bioremediation technique? Choose the correct answers:

(a) Bioremediation is a process that reduces naturally occurring biodegradation in nature.
(b) Bioremediation provides an efficient way of disposing any kind of hazardous waste materials.
(c) Bioremediation uses genetically engineered microorganisms specifically designed to degrade contaminants present in soil.
(d) All of the above.
```
The correct answer is 'd' i.e all of the above statements are true. Option A is incorrect because it states the opposite of the actual definition of bioremediation. Option B is also incorrect because Bioremediation is not primarily used for disposal but rather for cleanup of environmental pollutants. Option C is partially correct since genetic engineering can be employed to create more effective bacteria or other microorganisms capable of degrading specific pollutant molecules.

prompt.content:
2. ऋग्वेद-कालीन आर्यों और सिन्धु घाटी के लोगों की संस्कृति के बीच अंतर के संबंध में, निम्नलिखित कथनों में से कौन-सा/से सही है/हैं?
1- ऋग्वेद-कालीन आर्य कवच और शिरस्त्रण (हेलमेट) का उपयोग करते थे जबकि सिन्धु घाटी सभ्यता के लोगों में इनके उपयोग का कोई साध्य नहीं मिलता।
2- ऋग्वेद-कालीन आर्यों को स्वर्ण, चाँदी और ताम्र का ज्ञान था जबकि सिन्धु घाटी के लोगों को कवल ताम्र और लोह का ज्ञान था।
3- ऋग्वेद-कालीन आर्यों ने घोड़े को पालतू बना लिया था जबकि इस बात का कोई साक्ष्य नहीं है कि सिन्धु घाअी के लोग इस पशु को जानते थे।

नीचे दिए गए कूट का प्रयोग कर सही उत्तर चुनिएः

(a) केवल 1
(b) केवल 2 और 3
(c) केवल 1 और 3
(d) 1, 2 और 3
